definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: The government has been trying to slow the economy, by reining in runaway lending.
sentences.chinese: 当局已经努力放慢经济增长，严加管制贷款流失。

sentences.english: The country’s car industry is so strongly protected that foreign cars are rarely seen there.
sentences.chinese: 该国对汽车工业严加保护，外国汽车甚为罕见。

sentences.english: The traditional law of Tong ethnic group also strictly prohibits thefts and burglaries.
sentences.chinese: 侗族的传统法律也对偷盗行为严加禁止。

sentences.english: Any information we receive from you will, of course, be held in strict confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我们从您处收到的任何信息定会严加保密。

sentences.english: The goddess delivered the heifer to Argus, to be strictly watched.
sentences.chinese: 那女神就把这头小母牛交给阿尔戈斯严加看管。

sentences.english: Kawashima Kimi will Bai Dayi escorted successfully, on to his front to the Clssical stood maintenance.
sentences.chinese: 川岛君将白大怡护送成功，上锋令他对熹园严加维护。

sentences.english: That man has sinister designs. You must guard against his every move.
sentences.chinese: 这个人心怀叵测，对他的一举一动，都要严加提防。

sentences.english: The policeman rapped the driver for his violation of traffic regulations.
sentences.chinese: 由于司机违反交通规则，警察对他严加批评。

definition: to take strict precautions/on your guard
in order to warn against following bad examples (idiom)/as a warning to others
